short_description: Find the state sequence that produces the observation sequence with the highest probability, with respecting to each trained HMM.
long_description: Given a Hidden Markov Model theta = (A, B, Pi) and an observation sequence, find the state sequence that produces the observation sequence with the highest probability.

argument_clauses.name: InitStateModelColumn
argument_clauses.rDescription: The name of the model attribute column in the init.state.prob table.
argument_clauses.description: The name of the model attribute column in the InitStateProb table.

argument_clauses.name: InitStateColumn
argument_clauses.rDescription: The name of the state attribute column in the init.state.prob table.
argument_clauses.description: The name of the state attribute column in the InitStateProb table.

argument_clauses.name: InitStateProbColumn
argument_clauses.rDescription: The name of the initial probability column in the init.state.prob table.
argument_clauses.description: The name of the initial probability column in the InitStateProb table.

argument_clauses.name: TransAttributeColumn
argument_clauses.rDescription: The name of the model attribute column in the state.transition.prob table.
argument_clauses.description: The name of the model attribute column in the TransProb table.

argument_clauses.name: TransFromStateColumn
argument_clauses.rDescription: The name of the source of the state transition column in the state.transition.prob table.
argument_clauses.description: The name of the source of the state transition column in the TransProb table.

argument_clauses.name: TransToStateColumn
argument_clauses.rDescription: The name of the target of the state transition column in the state.transition.prob table.
argument_clauses.description: The name of the target of the state transition column in the TransProb table.

argument_clauses.name: TransProbColumn
argument_clauses.rDescription: The name of the state transition probability column in the state.transition.prob table.
argument_clauses.description: The name of the state transition probability column in the TransProb table.

argument_clauses.name: EmitModelColumn
argument_clauses.rDescription: The name of the model attribute column in the emission.prob table.
argument_clauses.description: The name of the model attribute column in the EmissionProb table.

argument_clauses.name: EmitStateColumn
argument_clauses.rDescription: The name of the state attribute in the emission.prob table.
argument_clauses.description: The name of the state attribute in the EmissionProb table.

argument_clauses.name: EmitObsColumn
argument_clauses.rDescription: The name of the observation attribute column in the emission.prob table.
argument_clauses.description: The name of the observation attribute column in the EmissionProb table.

argument_clauses.name: EmitProbColumn
argument_clauses.rDescription: The name of the emission probability in the emission.prob table.
argument_clauses.description: The name of the emission probability in the EmissionProb table.

argument_clauses.name: ModelColumn
argument_clauses.rDescription: The name of the column that contains the model attribute. If you specify this argument, then model_attribute must match a model_key in the observation.partition clause.
argument_clauses.description: The name of the column that contains the model attribute. If you specify this argument, then model_attribute must match a model_key in the PARTITION BY clause.

argument_clauses.name: SeqColumn
argument_clauses.rDescription: The name of the column that contains the sequence attribute. The sequence_attribute must be a sequence attribute in the observation.partition clause.
argument_clauses.description: The name of the column that contains the sequence attribute. The sequence_attribute must be a sequence attribute in the PARTITION BY clause.

argument_clauses.name: ObsColumn
argument_clauses.rDescription: The name of the column that contains the observed symbols. Note: Observed symbols are case-sensitive.
argument_clauses.description: The name of the column that contains the observed symbols. Note: Observed symbols are case-sensitive.

argument_clauses.name: Accumulate
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the names of the columns in input_table that the function copies to the output table.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the names of the columns in input_table that the function copies to the output table.

argument_clauses.name: SkipColumn
argument_clauses.rDescription: The name of the column whose values determine whether the function skips the row. The function skips the row if the value is “true”, “yes”, “y”, or “1”. The function does not skip the row if the value is “false”, “f”, “no”, “n”, “0”, or NULL.
argument_clauses.description: The name of the column whose values determine whether the function skips the row. The function skips the row if the value is “true”, “yes”, “y”, or “1”. The function does not skip the row if the value is “false”, “f”, “no”, “n”, “0”, or NULL.

argument_clauses.name: SequenceMaxSize
argument_clauses.rDescription: The maximum length, in rows, of a sequence in the observation table.
argument_clauses.description: The maximum length, in rows, of a sequence in the observation table.
